central_thesis: The Temple of Set's core philosophy centers on the individual's deliberate application of 'Black Magic' through 'Words' such as Thelema, Indulgence, Xeper, and Remanifestation to achieve conscious self-deification, evolution, and a renewed, higher 'Coming Into Being', explicitly opposing 'cosmic lowest-common-denominator laws' and challenging external societal misconceptions and persecution.

structure_content.summary: This article defines and elaborates on core Setian concepts: Remanifestation as a renewed 'Coming Into Being' through conscious 'Black Magic'; Xeper as the primary 'Word' of the Æon of Set, representing ongoing evolution; Thelema as individual 'will' in the Æon of HarWer; and Indulgence as a deliberate act of defiance against natural order to achieve higher states in the Age of Satan. It distinguishes these 'Words' as tools for magicians to attain desired states of being and emphasizes 'deliberate actions' as key to successful Black Magic and higher Remanifestations. The piece also touches on Setian perspectives on reincarnation, advocating for conscious survival beyond the physical body and rejecting predestination.

structure_content.chapter_title: [2] From the Chairman, Council of Nine
structure_content.summary: James Lewis V° announces the election of Magister Robert Menschel and Magister Stephen Flowers to the Council of Nine, filling vacated seats. He also confirms his continued service as Chairman for another year and expresses gratitude for Magistra Margaret Wendall's past dedication. This section outlines key administrative decisions and personnel changes within the Temple's leadership.

A poem describing a fierce battle involving trolls, etins, and giants, set in a wild, mountainous landscape. It depicts imagery of combat, steel, ice, and gore, culminating in silence and shadows, serving as a thematic or symbolic piece within the publication, potentially representing conflict or the darker aspects of being.

A review of the 1977 film 'Doctor Dracula', highlighting its plot involving an occult group attempting eternal life by reincarnating Svengali's soul. The review notes the film's questionable merit but points out its connection to the occult community, specifically mentioning Anton Szandor LaVey as a technical consultant, which adds a layer of cultural relevance for Setian readers by linking to other forms of modern Satanism.

Announces the appointment of Priestess Nancy K. Flowers as the Temple of Set's new Executive Director. Her experience with Bull of Ombos Pylon, Orders of the Trapezoid and Vampyre is cited, emphasizing her skills. This role centralizes administrative functions, acting as a primary point of contact for Setians seeking connection with the Priesthood.

Discusses the creation of new plastic medallions designed by Priestess Linda Reynolds, praised for their quality and described as 'miniature ritual chambers' for individual Setians. This section highlights the importance of aesthetic and magical quality in Temple of Set artifacts, comparing them to earlier Pentagram and Baphomet medallions.

Provides updates on upcoming Temple of Set conclaves. The Set-IX Conclave is scheduled for October 26-30, XXIII in Toronto, Ontario, with details on accommodations and registration fees. Future plans include exploring Set-X in London (October XXIV/1989) and potentially Set-XI in Honolulu, aiming to make conclaves accessible and enjoyable 'vacation experiences' that combine Temple events with local tourist activities.

Details the ongoing legal battle involving Lt. Col. Michael Aquino (president of the Temple of Set) in San Francisco, stemming from accusations related to child molestation. The article critiques the District Attorney's office and SFPD's handling of the case, specifically highlighting officer Sandi Gallant's role in disseminating misinformation about Satanism. It describes efforts to resolve the situation cooperatively while preparing for further legal action, including potential court-martial charges against Chaplain Adams-Thompson.

key_concepts.definition: A renewed Coming Into Being, a rebirth brought about as a result of all previous work done and wisdom gathered, acting as a deliberate act of Black Magic by the Initiate to achieve higher states of existence.

The primary 'Word' of the Æon of Set, understood as a noun/verb word representing an ongoing process of evolving and 'Coming into Being' towards a higher level of existence, achieved through deliberate work.

Defined as 'will' in the Æon of HarWer, signifying the unique, separate quality of each rational, intelligent being, enabling individuals to chart their own course in life. Used deliberately by magicians to attain desired states of being.

An act of operation in defiance of the natural order of things (in the Age of Satan), where the Satanist gains finer intellectual and material things through will, by turning the self towards the 'highest and best' - thus categorized as Black Magic.

Any 'deliberate actions' undertaken by an Initiate to achieve specific goals, particularly self-evolution and higher states of Remanifestation, in opposition to 'cosmic lowest-common-denominator laws'.

Conceptual tools (like Thelema, Xeper, Remanifestation) that are either 'æonic in nature' (instituting a new æon) or 'enhance the primary Word of the æon', used by the magician to analyze and deliberately choose to attain desired states of being.
An ongoing process of evolution, not a one-time experience, where factors bind together to produce a being operating at a significantly higher level than originally.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a system of individualistic magical practice centered on conscious self-evolution and the attainment of higher states of being, referred to as 'Black Magic'. This system is predicated on 'deliberate actions' and the conscious 'Word-use' of key Setian concepts (Thelema, Indulgence, Xeper, Remanifestation) to shape one's future and manifest desired states. The Initiate is viewed as the 'captain of his own ship', responsible for charting their course through life and actively opposing 'cosmic lowest-common-denominator laws' to achieve greater freedom and potentially 'life eternal'. The process of 'Coming Into Being' is emphasized as an ongoing, deliberate journey towards a higher operational level.
tools: Words (Thelema, Indulgence, Xeper, Remanifestation) as conceptual instruments for shaping reality and self-evolution.
Individual mind: recognized for its 'enormous creativity' and ability to process data to control environs and future.
Logic and reasoning: key ingredients for understanding life eternal and practical application.
Work: essential for achieving higher states of being and the 'highest possible of Remanifestations'.
Medallions: described as 'miniature ritual chambers' for the individual Setian, suggesting their use in personal magical focus or resonance.
rituals: Application of 'The Eonic Formula' ('I Have Come Into Being And Created That Which Has Come Into Being.') as a foundational principle for conscious creation and evolution.
Deliberate actions and willed behavior to bring about 'Remanifestation' and other desired states, classified as 'Black Magic'.
Conscious 'Word-use' of Thelema (will) to attain desired states of being and chart one's life course.
Reorientation of 'Indulgence' to seek the 'highest and best' aspects of life, categorizing it as Black Magic for refinement.
Working towards 'Xeper' as an ongoing process of evolving and 'Coming Into Being' to a higher level of existence.
Working (e.g., 'LBM Working' mentioned in relation to new cards) which implies magical operations utilizing specific intent and possibly artifacts.

relevant_quotes.text: The Eonic Formula: 'I Have Come Into Being And Created That Which Has Come Into Being.'

Definition: Remanifestation is a renewed Coming Into Being, a rebirth brought about as a result of all the previous work done and wisdom gathered. It acts in the form of a noun as a Word and a verb in that it is an action brought about through willed behavior. Note that carefully: It is a deliberate act on the part of the Initiate and as such is an act of Black Magic.
Deliberate actions are the key to successful Black Magic.
Each man has to cut his own way through the jungle.

By ourselves is evil done, By ourselves we pain endure, By ourselves we cease from wrong. By ourselves we become pure. No one sees us but ourselves, No one can and no one may. We ourselves must tread the Path; Magi only point out the way.

Life is so strong that it defies the bounds of petty logic in mere causality. Human life can transcend the individual and partake of the universe through an intense crystallization of form, and that is how reincarnation is possible if the spirit is strong.

As any reader of the Scroll knows, every one of the above statements is completely false - but this is the sort of stuff being regularly gushed by Gallant to law-enforcement officials all over the country. Remember, as the Examiner reported, she is 'recommended frequently by other law-enforcement agencies as the primary expert on ritualistic and Satanic child abuse'.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue of 'The Scroll of Set' is highly relevant for understanding the internal philosophical and operational dynamics of the Temple of Set in the late 1980s. It provides detailed definitions of core Setian concepts (Remanifestation, Xeper, Thelema, Indulgence) as specific forms of 'Black Magic' aimed at individual self-deification and conscious evolution, distinguishing them from more generic occult or 'couch-potato status' endeavors. The extensive account of the legal battle involving Michael Aquino and the detailed critique of law enforcement's misinformation (particularly Officer Sandi Gallant's erroneous 'intelligence') offers crucial insight into the external challenges, societal misconceptions, and persecution faced by the Temple of Set, framing its development within a hostile social context. It illuminates how the organization defended its practices and philosophy against unfounded accusations, underscoring its commitment to 'high ethical standards' despite public misrepresentation.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily aimed at Initiates and prospective members of the Temple of Set, providing philosophical instruction, organizational updates, and a defense against external criticisms. It also serves as a vital historical document for scholars and practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in modern Satanism, Setianism, and the socio-legal history of occult organizations in the late 20th century. Magicians interested in systems of self-evolution and 'Black Magic' as defined by the Temple of Set would find the conceptual explanations technically informative.
